item.title: The Most Important Design Jobs Of The Future
item.description:
The Most Important Design Jobs Of The Future

Culture Designer and a few others seem to be missing - please add to the list.

item.title: We Are People by Victoria Monét
item.description:
We Are People by Victoria Monét

Nightmares & Lullabies Act 1 is Victoria Monet's first body of work made available to her fans and supporters. It is also available for purchase on itunes. Connect with her here: www.VictoriaMonetMusic.com If you like what you hear, hashtag #NandL (Nightmares & Lullabies) plus the name of your favorite song from the project in a separate hashtag.

item.title: Every insightful tip on Slack implementation put in the right context could prove useful. #TakeNote
item.description:
Every insightful tip on Slack implementation put in the right context could prove useful. #TakeNote

Matt Haughey's tips for organizing your group to get more done A little while ago, we got this tweet: Brady asks how best a science lab can share resources and track team projects within Slack, but any answers I give to this researcher work equally well on almost any small team.

item.title: Conversations and narratives are the new documents - What's The Future of Work?
item.description:
Conversations and narratives are the new documents - What's The Future of Work?

With the emergence of writing, physical presence was no longer necessary for sharing information. In other words, a person's being there was not necessary for their influence to be felt. As typing replaced handwriting or when movable type replaced the hand copying of words, it became even easier to communicate with words that replicated ideas and simulated human interaction without face-to-face contact.

item.title: Digital globalization: The new era of global flows
item.description:
Digital globalization: The new era of global flows

Soaring flows of data and information now generate more economic value than the global goods trade. Conventional wisdom says that globalization has stalled. But although the global goods trade has flattened and cross-border capital flows have declined sharply since 2008, globalization is not heading into reverse.

item.title: Crowdsourcing - The way of the future?
item.description:
Crowdsourcing - The way of the future?

Will R&D departments be replaced by crowdsourcing? Or at least partly? A problem solved is a problem halved, the old saying goes. But what happens when you share a problem with an abundance of people instead of just a few colleagues? Research and development is usually regarded as top secret and fiercely guarded against prying eyes.
